business.headline: Sensex falls over 450 points, Nifty declines; Adani Enterprises jumps 7%The S&P BSE Sensex ended 450.94 points lower at 78,248.13, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 168.50 points lower at 23,644.90.

Greaves Cotton share price surges 13% to hit 52-week high today. Here's why Greaves Cotton share price hit 52-week high. The share which had closed at Rs 281.83 on Friday, opened at Rs 288.70 on Monday.
Are fixed deposits still the best bet for Indian investors?Fixed deposits are safe but face risks like limited protection, reinvestment challenges, and low post-tax real returns.

Stock market in January 2025: Will investors face a tough start to the year? Historically, January has often been a challenging month for equity markets, with the NSE Nifty 50 index recording losses in 13 out of the past 20 years.

Budget 2025: When was the last major income tax relief given? Budget 2025: The last Union Budget did not make changes to the old tax regime but introduced modifications to the new tax regime to make it more appealing.

Stock markets in 2025: What's next for Sensex and Nifty in the new year?Can Indian equities continue their upward climb, or will a mix of global and domestic hurdles create a rocky road ahead? Here is all you need to know.

Explained: Why Mamata Machinery share price tanked 5% todayMamata Machinery share price: The decline comes after the company's spectacular stock market debut last week, with analysts attributing the fall to profit booking by retail investors capitalising on the massive listing gains.

Unimech Aerospace IPO listing: Check latest GMP and share price predictionUnimech Aerospace IPO listing: In the grey market, Unimech Aerospace shares are commanding a robust premium of Rs 715, reflecting strong demand.

Sagility India share price gains nearly 3%. Will it continue to rally?Sagility India share price: At around 11:30 am, the stock was trading 2.58% higher at Rs 55.25 after opening at Rs 55.01 and reaching an intraday high of Rs 56.44.
ITR filing simplified: 5 updates you should knowUpdated tax rules, including pre-filled forms and flexible return filing, aim to reduce errors and ensure seamless compliance for taxpayers.

Explained: Why DAM Capital share price fell over 7% todayDAM Capital stock price: The sell-off is attributed to profit booking, a common trend after sharp initial gains. Analysts had previously offered mixed views on the company's shares.

Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: Check GMP, price band, key datesIndo Farm Equipment IPO: The price band is fixed at Rs 204-215 per share, with a lot size of 69 shares. The issue will close on Thursday, January 2.
Carraro India share listing: Stock list at Rs 660 vs IPO price of Rs 704Carraro India share price: On the NSE, the shares began trading at Rs 651, a discount of Rs 53 or 7.53%.
Ventive Hospitality share price lists at Rs 718.15 on BSE at 12% premium Ventive Hospitality listing: On the National Stock Exchange (NSE), the stock opened at Rs 716, reflecting an 11.35% premium.

Senores Pharmaceuticals shares list at 54% premium, bumper debut on D-StreetSenores Pharmaceuticals listing: Senores Pharmaceuticals shares opened at Rs 600 on the National Stock Exchange at a premium of 53.45% over its IPO price of 391.

JSW Energy share price gains 6%. Why are brokerages bullish on the stock? JSW Energy stock: Brokerages are bullish on the shares of JSW Energy after the company's wholly-owned subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy signed a major deal.
Sensex, Nifty start week lower; Adani Enterprises gain 3% in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 76.67 points to 78,623.40, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 35.25 points to 23,778.15 as of 9:23 AM.
Vodafone Idea shares in focus today: 2 things to know about the telecom stockVodafone Idea shares closed at Rs 7.49 on Friday, down 0.93%. The stock has fallen 56% so far in 2024.
Ventive Hospitality, Carraro: GMPs of 2 IPOs ahead of D-Street debut todayAllotment of shares for the IPOs of Ventive Hospitality and Carraro was completed on December 26, 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Rohit Sharma concedes dip in form and captaincy but mum about Test futureAustralia vs India, 4th Test: Rohit Sharma acknowledged concerns about his batting form and captaincy but remained tight-lipped about his future in the team. Rohit has managed just 31 runs in six innings in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25.

BJP roasts Rahul Gandhi over Vietnam trip, Congress says 'Why does it bother you?'In a fresh round of political sparring, the BJP slammed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for allegedly travelling to Vietnam to celebrate the New Year, just days after the death of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

Prashant Kishor's defence as lathicharged exam aspirants ask 'Where were you?'Protesting Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) aspirants asked political strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor to step back from the protest site at Patna's Gardanibagh late on Sunday after he was absent during the lathicharge by Bihar Police.

Budget 2025: When was the last major income tax relief given? Budget 2025: The last Union Budget did not make changes to the old tax regime but introduced modifications to the new tax regime to make it more appealing.

Which is safest seat on a plane; front, middle or rear? Here's a deep diveFatal air crashes in Kazakhstan and South Korea, where survivors were evacuated from the rear of the jets, have raised a buzz if the seats at the plane's end are safer than others. Are they really safe?

Army officer assaulted as mob storms Kerala NCC camp over food poisoning claimsAn Army officer was assaulted during an NCC training camp in Kerala's Thrikkakkara after a crowd disrupted operations following a food poisoning scare among cadets.

Missing 22-year-old Kerala student found dead in Scottish riverThe body of Santra Saju, a 22-year-old Indian student from Kerala, has been found in a river near Newbridge, Scotland. Saju, a student at Heriot-Watt University in Edinburgh, went missing on December 6. Police Scotland confirmed the discovery, stating that while formal identification is pending, Saju's family has been informed.

Was Yashasvi Jaiswal out or not out? Controversial DRS call explainedIND vs AUS: Yashasvi Jaiswal was dismissed on 84 via a controversial DRS call on the final day of the MCG Test. Jaiswal was given caught out, despite the snicko meter showing no spike at all.
Asteroid to hit Earth? A new equation could tell us whenThis advancement could provide crucial early warnings about incoming asteroids, allowing for timely intervention or acceptance of our fate.

Elon Musk talks about life on Mars, says this planet will have direct democracyElon Musk has once again shared his vision for the future of humanity on Mars, offering a glimpse into how he imagines the governance of a future colony. He also shared details on financial and technological challenges for building a city on Mars.
This popular heartburn drug is banned in US but widely sold in India. Why?India to continue to allow the sale of Ranitidine, a drug under scrutiny for potential cancer risks due to NDMA impurities.

Mamata Banerjee in Sandeshkhali: Big money spent here to spread fake newsMamata Banerjee Sandeshkhali Visit: This is Mamata Banerjee's first visit to Sandeshkhali since it was marred by large-scale protests earlier this year over allegations of land grabbing and sexual harassment by local Trinamool Congress leaders.

Spadex launch tonight: India aims to become 4th nation to master space dockingThe mission involves launching two specially designed satellites, each weighing approximately 220 kg, using the workhorse Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV) rocket.

Steely Australia break India's resistance to win MCG thriller, end 13-year streakAustralia vs India, 4th Test: Australia rode on an all-round bowling show on Day 5 to beat India by 184 runs and take a 2-1 lead in the five-match series on Monday. India paid the price for their big stars, including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, not showing enough fight with the bat in the final innings.

Arvind Kejriwal's new Delhi poll promise: Rs 18,000 salary for priests if AAP winsFormer Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal made a major announcement on Monday (December 30), promising a monthly salary of Rs 18,000 for priests of temples and granthis of gurudwaras if AAP comes back to power in the upcoming elections.

Elon Musk calls H-1B visa system 'broken' amid 'civil war' with MAGA criticsTech billionaire Elon Musk declared the H-1B visa system "broken" and in need of "major reform," just days after vowing to fiercely defend the programme that has sparked a rift in the MAGA movement.
I tested 5 heatless curling methods to find the best one. Here's what I foundFrom foam rollers to headbands, heatless curlers are going viral across social media. But which one works the best?

'Bird strike, bird strike, go-around': Final moments of crashed South Korea planeSouth Korea Plane Crash: The Jeju Air flight issued a mayday call and belly-landed before crashing into a barrier and bursting into flames. "Mayday Mayday Mayday. Bird strike, bird strike, go-around," the pilot radioed, according to flight recordings.

Allu Arjun's bail verdict in theatre stampede case postponed to January 3Allu Arjun stampede case: The Nampally court will announce its verdict on actor Allu Arjun's bail petition on January 3 after arguments presented by his legal team and the Chikkadapally police's counter-affidavit.

Mohanlal on male stars romancing younger co-actors: If you're healthy, why not?Mohanlal addressed the ongoing debate about male stars romancing younger actresses, saying confidence and audience acceptance matter more than age. The Barroz director also reflected on his evolving career.

Rohit's cheeky reaction to Pant's frustrating dismissalsBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: India captain Rohit Sharma expressed his disappointment with Rishabh Pant's shot selection in both innings of the Boxing Day Test. Pant faced the heat after throwing his wicket away at a crucial juncture on Day 5 of the Test, which India lost by 184 runs.

DMK under fire over Anna University sex assault case, women's panel probesA committee formed by the National Commission of Women arrived at Anna University to investigate the sexual assault of a 19-year-old student within the campus on December 23.

Brave man: Congress leader's shoutout to Diljit Dosanjh for Manmohan Singh praiseDiljit Dosanjh honoured late PM Manmohan Singh at his Guwahati concert, earning praise from Congress leader Supriya Shrinate, who called it a brave gesture and criticised the film industry for not 'condoling the death of India's former Prime Minister'.

Kriti Sanon on today's awards shows: How much does it matter? It's all PR nowActor Kriti Sanon reflected on the PR-driven culture of today's awards shows, contrasting it with the simplicity of the 90s. She questioned their relevance and authenticity.

Hidden Love star Zhao Lusi's pic in wheelchair goes viral, team shares statementChinese actress Zhao Lusi, known for her role in Hidden Love, was recently hospitalised, sparking concerns over her health. Her team shared a statement and announced a suspension of all work commitments for a speedy recovery.

Watch: Amitabh Bachchan distributes gifts to fans outside his house in MumbaiAmitabh Bachchan continued his Sunday tradition by meeting fans outside his Mumbai residence, Jalsa. During the visit, he also handed out gifts to those gathered. The video of the event has since been shared widely on social media.

Amitabh, Jaya and Abhishek Bachchan dazzle in traditional attire at Mumbai weddingAmitabh, Jaya, and Abhishek Bachchan attended a wedding reception in Mumbai. Aishwarya and Aaradhya skipped the event as they are on vacation.

sports.headline: Jasprit Bumrah, Joe Root among nominees for ICC Test Cricket of 2024 awardIndia fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah, who took 71 wickets in 2024, has been nominated for the ICC Test Cricketer of the Year award. Joe Root, Harry Brook and Kamindu Mendis are the other three in the shortlist.

Will Starc be available for Sydney Test? Cummins gives positive updatePat Cummins confirmed Mitchell Starc's availability for the Sydney Test, alleviating concerns over his back injury. Starc bowled through pain in Melbourne, displaying resilience, and his availability strengthens Australia's chances in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy decider.

Rohit Sharma's bizarre tactical claim after MCG loss: Wanted to go for the winIndia captain Rohit Sharma revealed that India were backing themselves to chase down 340 runs on the final day of the Boxing Day Test match. Rohit's thought process seemed bizarre given the fact that no team in the past 96 years has successfully chased a target exceeding 300 at the MCG.

UFC star responds to speculationConor McGregor, one of the most decorated UFC stars in the history of combat sport, nearly confirmed the bout in Mumbai, responding to a news report on social media. The Wankhede Stadium, which hosted the cricket World Cup final in 2011, is speculated to host the bout.

Australia vs India: Bumper MCG crowd on Day 5 breaks Bradman-era recordThe Boxing Day Test between Australia and India at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) entered the history books on Monday, the fifth and final day of the match. This Test holds the all-time attendance record at the MCG, surpassing the previous mark of 350,534 set during the 1936-37 Ashes series.

Rohit Sharma wastes patient start as poor Test run in Australia continuesBoxing Day Test: Rohit Sharma failed to capitalise on his patient start, again falling to Australian captain Pat Cummins. Rohit managed to score only 9 runs on Day 5 of the MCG Test.

After yes to jeans, Magnus Carlsen agrees to play World Blitz ChampionshipMagnus Carlsen has confirmed his participation in the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz tournament and will play in jeans after a change in the rules. Carlsen had pulled out of the tournament after the sport's global governing body fined him for wearing jeans.

Workhorse Bumrah picks 13th 5-wicket haul after hardest toil in MCG TestBoxing Day Test: Jasprit Bumrah returned with excellent figures of 5 for 57 to help India bowl out Australia for 234. Bumrah bowled 53.2 overs in the ongoing MCG Test, the most he has ever bowled in his career.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
